name: ProShares Short High Yield
description: ProShares Short High Yield (SJB) is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that aims to provide inverse exposure to the performance of high-yield bonds, specifically targeting the Bloomberg Barclays U.S. High Yield Very Liquid Index. Launched by ProShares, a leading provider of alternative investment solutions, SJB seeks to achieve results that correspond to the inverse (-1x) of the daily performance of the index before fees and expenses. This fund is designed for investors who are looking to hedge against a decline in high-yield bond prices or to speculate on potential downturns in the high-yield bond market. By using SJB, investors can gain exposure to the credit risk associated with lower-rated corporate bonds without directly holding the bonds themselves. The fund is actively managed and employs derivatives to achieve its investment objective, making it a suitable choice for sophisticated investors who understand the risks involved in trading inverse ETFs. With a focus on providing a transparent and efficient way to gain short exposure to the high-yield sector, SJB has become a popular tool for portfolio diversification and risk management in volatile market conditions.
